title: At least 35 killed in Israeli attack on Gaza residential block

title: US stocks make historic gains after Trump pauses some tariffs
snippets: But Trump also raises tariffs on goods from China to at least 125% "effective immediately".
summary: Former President Donald Trump announced an immediate increase in tariffs on goods from China, raising them to at least 125%. This action represents a significant escalation in trade tensions between the United States and China.
titles: US stocks make historic gains after Trump pauses some tariffs

title: US pauses higher tariffs for most countries but hits China harder
snippets: Trump authorises a "lowered reciprocal tariff of 10%" for most countries, except China, while negotiations continue.
summary: President Trump has authorized a reduction in tariffs to 10% for most countries, excluding China, as negotiations with them are still ongoing. This decision aims to adjust the trade balance more favorably while maintaining a firm stance in trade discussions with China.
titles: US pauses higher tariffs for most countries but hits China harder

title: China retaliates against Trump's 'trade tyranny' with 84% tariffs
snippets: Manufacturers and exporters are scrambling after 104% tariff on China-made goods comes into effect.
summary: Manufacturers and exporters are urgently adjusting their operations in response to a new 104% tariff imposed on goods made in China. This significant increase in tariffs has prompted immediate action within the industry to address the challenges posed by the escalated costs of importing Chinese products.
titles: China retaliates against Trump's 'trade tyranny' with 84% tariffs

title: Trump shocks with tariff increase on China, ‘pause’ for everyone else
snippets: Donald Trump announced a 90-day ‘pause’ on individual tariffs for dozens of countries but increasing rates on China.
summary: Donald Trump has declared a 90-day suspension of individual tariffs for numerous countries, while simultaneously announcing an increase in tariff rates on China. This move marks a significant shift in trade policy, directly affecting international trade relations and economic interactions between the United States and China.
titles: Trump shocks with tariff increase on China, ‘pause’ for everyone else

title: Masters chairman praises efforts of Augusta National employees to recover following Helene
snippets: Apr. 9—AUGUSTA — As the golf world turns its collective eye to the Masters Tournament this week, only the most keen observers can tell that Augusta National Golf Club was hit by hurricane-force winds six months ago. And that's a testament to the hard work of the club's workers, Augusta National and Masters Chairman Fred Ridley said April 9 at his annual "State of the Masters" address. "I hope ...
summary: In April, during the "State of the Masters" address, Augusta National and Masters Chairman Fred Ridley highlighted the remarkable recovery of the Augusta National Golf Club from hurricane-force winds six months prior. Thanks to the diligent efforts of the club's workers, the damage was virtually unnoticeable by the time of the Masters Tournament, showcasing the resilience and dedication of the team behind the scenes.
titles: Masters chairman praises efforts of Augusta National employees to recover following Helene

title: Is Nico Harrison at Luka Doncic's return? 'Fire Nico' chants, mural explained

titles: Is Nico Harrison at Luka Doncic's return? 'Fire Nico' chants, mural explained

title: Wiggins returns to Heat's lineup against Bulls after missing 6 games because of hamstring injury
snippets: Miami Heat forward Andrew Wiggins returned to the lineup against the Chicago Bulls on Wednesday night after missing six games because of a right hamstring injury.  Wiggins had missed 15 of Miami’s 30 games due to a variety of ailments since the Heat acquired him from Golden State in the Jimmy Butler trade.  Coach Erik Spoelstra said he would be “mindful” of his minutes against Chicago.
summary: Miami Heat forward Andrew Wiggins returned to play against the Chicago Bulls after missing six games due to a right hamstring injury. Since being traded from Golden State in the Jimmy Butler trade, Wiggins has missed 15 of Miami's 30 games with various injuries. Coach Erik Spoelstra stated he would monitor Wiggins' playing time carefully during the game.
titles: Wiggins returns to Heat's lineup against Bulls after missing 6 games because of hamstring injury

title: S&P 500 Has Best Day Since 2008 as Trump Pauses Tariffs
snippets:
Just days after suffering their worst stretch in years, stocks rebounded on Wednesday to notch one of their best days of the 21st century after President Trump announced a 90-day pause on the tariffs that sent stocks across the globe spiraling last week.

The S&P 500 soared 9.5% on Wednesday, its biggest one-day gain since October 2008. The tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite skyrocketed 12.2%—its second-largest daily gain since the turn of the century and its best day since January 2001. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 7.8%, its best day since March 2020 and fifth-best since 2000.

Investors breathed a sigh of relief on Wednesday when President Trump implemented a 90-day pause on most of the tariffs that went into effect overnight. Trump shocked Wall Street last Wednesday when he unveiled tariffs that were broader and steeper than investors had expected. Stocks tumbled in the following days as economists warned the tariffs would likely weigh on global growth and stoke inflation. 

Wednesday’s rally recouped much of the losses the major indexes have suffered in the last week. The Nasdaq, which finished yesterday’s session more than 13% off its pre-“Liberation Day” close, is now down just 2.7%. The S&P 500 has pared its losses from 12.1% to 3.8%, and the Dow closed Wednesday 3.8% off its level before the tariffs were announced. 

“The stock market rebound is a combination of speculative investors needing to cover short positions; less fear of recession and stagflation; and optimism that tariff rates will ultimately end up lower than they are threatened today,” Comerica Bank Chief Economist Bill Adams said.  

The tariff pause comes just days before big banks are slated to kick off first-quarter earnings season, with JPMorgan Chase (JPM) scheduled to report on Friday. Its CEO Jamie Dimon warned in his annual letter to shareholders on Monday that the tariffs would slow down growth, and early Wednesday Dimon called a recession “a likely outcome” of the tariffs. Bank stocks surged in response to the tariff pause Wednesday.

Wednesday’s pause and rally could change the tone of earnings calls in the coming weeks. “This pause may provide companies with a clearer backdrop for their guidance, offering some relief to a market hungry for direction,” wrote Gina Bolvin, President of Bolvin Wealth Management Group, on Wednesday. (Analysts have been expecting tariff uncertainty to cause the number of companies offering sales and earnings guidance to drop sharply this quarter.) 

“However, uncertainty looms over what happens after the 90-day period, leaving investors to grapple with potential volatility ahead,” Bolvin added.
summary: Following a significant downturn due to broad and steep tariffs announced by President Trump, the stock market experienced a remarkable recovery on Wednesday after Trump declared a 90-day pause on most tariffs. This move resulted in the S&P 500 surging 9.5%, the Nasdaq Composite soaring 12.2%, and the Dow Jones Industrial Average rising 7.8%, marking one of the best days for stocks in the 21st century. This rebound helped recoup much of the losses suffered in the previous week, with major indexes significantly reducing their deficits. The pause in tariffs, announced just before the start of th
titles: S&P 500 Has Best Day Since 2008 as Trump Pauses Tariffs

title: S&P 500 Gains and Losses Today: Index Roars Back After Reprieve on 'Reciprocal' Tariffs
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • The S&P 500 surged 9.5% on Wednesday, April 9, roaring back in an afternoon rally after President Donald Trump temporarily suspended widespread tariffs.
  • AMD and other semiconductor companies' shares tore higher, recovering from recent losses driven by tariff concerns.
  • Delta Air Lines shares took off after the carrier topped quarterly earnings estimates, and shares of rival United Airlines also soared.


Major U.S. equities indexes surged after President Donald Trump announced a 90-day pause of "reciprocal" tariffs on imports from U.S. trading partners around the world, less than a day after the levies took effect.

After fluctuating in early trading, the S&P 500 screamed higher following the latest shift in trade policy, ending with a daily gain of 9.5%. The Dow advanced 7.9%, while the Nasdaq rocketed 12.2% higher.

The technology sector outperformed as stocks that had been clobbered by concerns about the impact of extensive tariffs clawed back some of their recent losses. Shares of microcontroller and analog chipmaker Microchip Technology (MCHP) jumped 27.1%, notching the best daily performance of any S&P 500 stock, while shares of power management semiconductor provider Monolithic Power Systems (MPWR) popped 23.4% higher.

Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) shares, which have garnered significant attention because of the firm's artificial intelligence (AI) chips, surged 23.8%. The push higher for the stock came in spite of a downgrade to "sector weight" from "overweight" by analysts at KeyBanc Capital Markets, who cited downside risks to gross margins amid increasing price competition with Intel (INTC).

Delta Air Lines (DAL) lifted the airline industry by reporting better-than-expected sales and profit results for its fiscal first quarter. Although Delta announced plans to cut back on capacity growth in the second half of the year as it navigates the uncertain economic environment, its shares took off following the strong earnings report, gaining 23.4% on Wednesday. Meanwhile, shares of rival carrier United Airlines (UAL) soared 26.1%.

Telsa (TSLA) shares gained 22.7% in the wake of the tariff reprieve. In addition, the research firm Benchmark included the electric vehicle maker's stock among its best investment ideas, noting a more attractive valuation following recent price declines, the potential for a recovery in sales driven by a new vehicle launch, and potential catalysts from Tesla's robotaxi and self-driving initiatives.

The heaviest loss among S&P 500 constituents was on Dollar General (DG) shares, which slipped 1.9%. The stock managed to buck the downtrend in the broader markets this week as concerns about deteriorating macroeconomic conditions boosted the outlook for cost-conscious consumers seeking bargains at the discount retailer's stores. Dollar General shares also attracted an upgrade earlier this week from analysts at Melius Research, who highlighted the company's relative lack of exposure to tariffs.

Shares of MarketAxess Holdings (MKTX), which operates an electronic trading platform for fixed-income securities, fell 1.5% after UBS trimmed its price target on the stock. Although analysts lifted their first-quarter earnings estimates to reflect increased credit volume, they anticipate that lower pricing could restrain revenue growth during the period.
summary: On April 9, 2025, U.S. stock markets experienced significant gains following President Donald Trump's announcement of a 90-day suspension of new reciprocal tariffs, reversing a previous decision. The S&P 500 surged 9.5%, the Dow increased by 7.9%, and the Nasdaq saw a 12.2% rise. Semiconductor companies like AMD and airline stocks such as Delta Air Lines benefited notably, with shares jumping due to the tariff pause and strong quarterly earnings, respectively. Conversely, Dollar General and MarketAxess Holdings saw declines amidst the broader market rally, attributed to concerns about macroeco
titles: S&P 500 Gains and Losses Today: Index Roars Back After Reprieve on 'Reciprocal' Tariffs

title: Trump Pauses Plans to Curb Nvidia H20 Chip Sales to Chinese Firms, Report Says
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • The White House has paused plans to curb sales of Nvidia H20 chips to Chinese firms, NPR reported Wednesday.
  • The development comes after CEO Jensen Huang attended a dinner at Mar-a-Lago last week, where President Trump made an appearance, according to the report.
  • The H20 chip is less powerful than Nvidia's latest tech, and is tailored to meet existing export restrictions.
  • Nvidia shares surged amid a broader market rally Wednesday after Trump announced a 90-day pause on most of the tariffs his administration announced last week. 


The Trump administration has paused plans to tighten restrictions on sales of Nvidia's (NVDA) H20 chip to companies in China, NPR reported Wednesday.

The H20 is less powerful than Nvidia’s latest chips and is tailored to meet existing U.S. export restrictions. The White House had been considering curbing Nvidia’s ability to sell the chip in China, but those plans were put on hold after CEO Jensen Huang attended a dinner at Mar-a-Lago last week, where President Trump made an appearance, according to the report.

Nvidia declined to remark on the report, while the Commerce Department did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

Nvidia shares soared over 18% Wednesday amid a broader market rally after Trump announced a 90-day pause on most of the tariffs his administration announced last week. In a Truth Social post, Trump said he felt the pause was needed because "more than 75 countries" had contacted his administration to make trade deals. The pause excluded China, which is instead facing a higher rate as tariffs on goods from the country increase to 125%. (Read Investopedia's live coverage of today's market action here.)
summary: The Trump administration has temporarily halted plans to impose further restrictions on the sale of Nvidia's H20 chips to Chinese companies. This decision followed a meeting between Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang and President Donald Trump at Mar-a-Lago. The H20 chip, designed to comply with current U.S. export controls, is less advanced than Nvidia's latest offerings. Amidst this development and a broader market rally, Nvidia's stock price increased by over 18% after President Trump announced a 90-day suspension of most new tariffs, although this pause does not apply to China, which faces a tariff i
titles: Trump Pauses Plans to Curb Nvidia H20 Chip Sales to Chinese Firms, Report Says

title: Plant-based waterproof material could replace single-use plastics
snippets: Cellulose, the main component of paper, can be turned into clear, waterproof objects such as cups that are almost indistinguishable from plastic, but break down more quickly
summary: Researchers have developed a method to transform cellulose, the primary substance in paper, into clear, waterproof objects resembling plastic, such as cups. Unlike traditional plastic, these cellulose-based products have the advantage of decomposing more rapidly, offering a more environmentally friendly alternative.
titles: Plant-based waterproof material could replace single-use plastics

title: What politicians so often get wrong about science
snippets: Governments love asking what scientific research will bring society, but the most important discoveries come from wondering without direction
summary: Scientific research often faces scrutiny from governments regarding its societal benefits. However, significant breakthroughs frequently result from exploratory inquiry without a predetermined objective. This highlights the value of curiosity-driven research beyond immediate practical applications.
titles: What politicians so often get wrong about science

title: Largest mammalian brain map ever could unpick what makes us human
snippets: A map of part of a mouse brain, which is expected to be generalisable to people, could help scientists understand behaviours, consciousness and even what it means to be human
summary: Scientists have created a detailed map of part of a mouse brain, believed to be applicable to human brains. This breakthrough is anticipated to advance the understanding of behaviors, consciousness, and the essence of being human.
titles: Largest mammalian brain map ever could unpick what makes us human

title: What the surprising lives of solitary animals reveals about us
snippets: A new understanding of why some animals evolved to be loners, and the benefits that brings, shows that a social lifestyle isn’t necessarily superior
summary: Recent research has shed light on why certain animals have evolved to lead solitary lives, highlighting the unique advantages of such a lifestyle. This study challenges the prevailing notion that social living is always the better evolutionary strategy, by demonstrating that for some species, being solitary can offer distinct benefits. This new understanding emphasizes that neither social nor solitary living is inherently superior, as both have evolved to suit specific survival and reproductive needs of different animals.
titles: What the surprising lives of solitary animals reveals about us

title: Can Amazon's soon-to-launch Kuiper satellites rival Musk's Starlink?
snippets: Amazon is aiming to launch its first operational satellites today to provide speedy internet connections in remote regions, but it will still take some time to catch up with its main competitor, SpaceX's Starlink
summary: Amazon plans to launch its inaugural operational satellites aimed at delivering fast internet to remote areas. Despite this significant step, the company acknowledges it will take time to reach the operational scale and coverage of its primary competitor, SpaceX's Starlink network.
titles: Can Amazon's soon-to-launch Kuiper satellites rival Musk's Starlink?
